intro: Tanacetum gayanum, commonly known as the Gaya tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, featuring finely divided, gray-green leaves and yellow-orange flower heads. Its aromatic properties are due to the presence of volatile compounds such as thujone and camphor. Tanacetum gayanum is often used in traditional medicine for its antiseptic and analgesic properties.
